Simage Market Positioning: Gaps & Opportunity
The Market Reality
All the metadata management leaders (Atlan, IBM watsonx, Informatica, Alation) focus on centralized, cloud-
based data assets — data warehouses, lakes, BI tools, SaaS platforms. They're excellent at cataloging
Snowﬂake, Databricks, Tableau, etc.
Gartner's 2025 Magic Quadrant for Metadata Management conﬁrms that metadata is now foundational to AI
readiness and modern data strategy. The market has shifted from passive catalogs to "active metadata" platforms
that orchestrate governance, lineage, and quality.
But they all share the same blind spots.
What the Market Misses
1. Endpoint Blind Spot
Why it exists: 28-35% of corporate data lives on laptops and local devices, outside IT's purview. Current
catalogs don't touch this — they require connectors to centralized systems. Employee laptops are "dark" by
design.
Simage opportunity: Index the edge. Run on endpoints, capture the data that never makes it to the cloud. We
ﬁnd what catalogs can't see.
2. Zero-Trust Metadata
Why it exists: Every major catalog requires reading content to catalog it — or at minimum, connecting to
systems with credentials. Privacy-conscious or regulated industries (defense, healthcare, legal) can't adopt them
freely.
Simage opportunity: Privacy-preserving indexing. We extract semantic meaning from metadata without ever
reading proprietary content. No upload. No access. Full visibility.
3. Passive Discovery Gap
Why it exists: Current solutions require active integration — IT has to set up connectors, conﬁgure crawls,
maintain pipelines. Shadow IT and personal ﬁle stores never get indexed because no one sets them up.

interoperability metadata are considered less effective. Vendors promoting open standards (OpenMetadata,
OpenLineage) are becoming major differentiators.
Simage opportunity: Metadata designed to ﬂow — in and out. We feed any catalog, any system, any AI. We
ingest metadata from external sources (public datasets, partner data, industry sources). Zero lock-in. We're

the upstream metadata source that enriches any downstream system.

"We discover the metadata that catalogs can't see — from endpoints to shadow IT — without ever touching
your content. And because we're open, that metadata ﬂows wherever you need it: your existing catalog,
